Author: Ikhazu
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: In early 2019 we will be moving to our own blockchain! It will be based on the Bitcoin core blockchain, but extended with a lot of extra features.  Just to name a few:  - up to 100k tx/sec - own blockchain explorer - asset support - POW/POS combination  And much more! $NEXT🚀🙌

The number of people getting banned is decreasing over time, and crypto accounts on Twitter is increasing on a daily basis.

Author: Ikhazu
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: Greetings NEXT.exchange community, below is an overview of what we as a team have on our to-do list for the coming week.  -Updating/rethinking the Escrow wallet which we recently developed for better transaction processing. It's quite possible that we may combine Escrow with the NEXT Chain for instant transactions. Basic Escrow should be available with the 1.0 release of our platform. Below is a screenshot, note the "Main Balance" and "Trade Balance" columns.    -Enabling more digital assets for trading. Shortly prior to launching the 1.0 version of our trading platform, the team decided that it would be better in terms of stability to kick off our exchange with only Ethereum (ERC20) based assets available for trading. During the next few days we will be making more assets available for trading while integrating new projects at the same time.  -New site dedicated solely to NEXT Chain Masternodes.  -Installing full Miningpool environment.  -Upgrading datacenter servers.  -Drafting marketing agreements with 3rd parties

Author: Ikhazu
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: We're also proud to announce that the public testnet is now live.  What is a masternode?  A masternode (MN) is simply a cryptocurrency full node or computer wallet that keeps a full copy of a given Blockchain in real-time. For example, the Bitcoin Blockchain has full nodes that are always up & running.  But, masternodes are considerably different in their functionality than are normal nodes. The NEXT. Chain is based on the Bitcoin Core Blockchain, with additional modifications. We have also adopted certain features from DASH i.e Masternodes, InstantSend, PrivateSend and Governance Proposals. Our aim is to achieve a fast and extremely cost efficient decentralized network for our exchange. We combine Proof of Work and Proof of Stake consensus algorithms. Our Network is a two-layer network.  Some of the special functions that these nodes perform are:  Blockrewards (45% PoW miners, 45% masternodes, and 10% superblocks. Masternodes receive seniority rewards based on their long term services). Increasing privacy of transactions Executing instant transactions Participating in governance and voting Enable budgeting and treasury system in cryptos Passive income for supporting a Blockchain network.  NEXT. Chain masternodes are not standalone. Instead, they are always communicating with other such nodes to uphold a decentralized network. PoS and PoW consensus mechanisms have their individual advantages and disadvantages. PoW is more secure, it requires computer hardware, computational power, and energy costs for upholding a Blockchain network and verifying data. PoS does not require computational calculations or costly computer hardware. Rather, it relies on staking coins to uphold a network. The PoW aspect utilizes the SHA256 algorithm for maintaining the Blockchain, while the PoS part requires Masternodes.  More information on the above attributes can be found below;  Proof-of-Work Proof-of-Stake SHA256 Algorithm Masternodes   What does it take to run a masternode?  Just like full nodes in a cryptocurrency, MN’s can be run by anyone. However, there is an entry barrier in place to ensure that the system does not become malicious. The entry barrier is what one needs to commit or collateralize certain units of that particular cryptocurrency to run a MN.  This is done to ensure that an MN owner does not cheat or corrupt the system and the best of doing so is by putting this entry barrier where the masternode operator has something at stake.  So, naturally, it becomes less likely that a masternode operator will cheat due to having something at stake. If a masternode operator chooses to be malicious, he will be punished in the form of devaluation of his or her own HODLings.  Now that you have understood the concept of masternode, let’s jump to what one needs to set it up:  Collateral of 25,000 NEXT is required to run one masternode A VPS or dedicated server to host the masternode, 24 x 7 A dedicated public IP address Up to 50GB of storage space for the Blockchain Our verification, including Know Your Customer (KYC) verification These are pretty much standard requirements for most masternode cryptocurrencies.  Now I know some you might be thinking that in order to meet all the above requirements, one needs to spend quite a bit of money. But, how can one profit?  This takes us to the next section of this write-up, which provides further clarity on the topic.  How are masternodes useful for cryptocurrency investors?  Masternodes are very useful for crypto investors because they provide monetary incentives. One can earn weekly or monthly interest on their cryptoholdings by running a masternode.  Our goal is to create a secure and fast system which will act as the backbone for all of our ecosystems transactions. Keeping in mind a circulating supply of around 3 million NEXT, it’s quite possible that our Masternode network will only consist of 30 to 60 masternodes during inception. By combining the best of PoS and PoW, will allow us to avoid security issues experienced by PoS networks harbouring a small amount of nodes.  We see holding a NEXT masternode as a rather exclusive and potentially profitable venture. Additionally, masternodes posses voting rights, which allows them to decide on directions in which our ecosystem grows and develops. Due to the network being rather small at the start, we will aim to restrict the quantity of masternodes obtainable by a single user to 1 masternode. To do so, we will require potential node holders to pass Know Your Customer (KYC) procedures.  Apply for a masternode  We select masternodes on a first come, first serve policy. Once you apply, and hold over 25,000 NEXT, we will run a check to ensure that all of the requirements to run a masternode are satisfied. As soon as we run out checks, and if you are approved, we will send you further information and custom scripts to set up a masternode.  Please login to apply for a masternode.

Author: Crypto-elf
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: A dutch guy translated the article:  Smart businessman or unreliable geezer?    23-03-2016  The curriculum vitae of an Eindhoven businessman who claims the acquisition of the controversial biodigester in Nistelrode raises serious concerns, according to the Dutch Newspaper Eindhovens Dagblad.  Is Chris van Steenbergen (35) from Eindhoven, whose company BiQ Group NV is taking over the controversial biodigester in Nistelrode, a smart businessman or an unreliable geezer? That question is important now that it has become known that Chris van Steenbergen is going to exploit the controversial biofermenter in Nistelrode.  The regional government withdrew the environmental permit, which leads to legal sabre-rattling. Whatever the conclusion, very clear is that when Van Steenbergen gets involved, business often ends nowhere.  Two companies went bankrupt under the leadership of Van Steenbergen: iSense BV in 2012 and iSwitch Global Group BV in 2005. In the last case, curator Lawrence van Woensel of Bogaerts & Groenen Lawyers, found that Christiaan van Steenbergen acted unlawfully. He was accused of fraudulent conveyance. He would have acted in the sale of inventory of the bankrupt company to another company he owned. The deal was therefore reversed. In a reaction, Van Steenbergen says about the bankruptcy of ten years ago: "I was not sued for the suspicious that I would have committed a fraudulent transfer or for the fact that I acted unlawfully."  Whatever the case, in recent years BiQ created a real Christmas tree with, for example, investment funds - each accommodated in its own private company (Ltd). At least nine Ltd’s, such as BiQ Services BV, BiQ Real Estate Fund BV and WiComm BV, were terminated within one year. The plan for a business bank, the BiQ Bank, also met with an untimely end. And a planned investment in a first part of the manure processor in Sterksel, a deal BiQ toots their own horn for, does not seem to continue, reports director Peter Schaminee. "The deadline has been running for months," he says. "But in spite of the agreement, no money has been transferred yet." Van Steenbergen describes this as 'nonsense': "It was just an application and not a commitment to finalize financing of the entire project.  It is a complex financing request and it takes time for investors to assess this opportunity."  True or not, BiQ is expert in generating media attention. Barely a few months ago - december last year - the company was looking for publicity with their project the 'internet of things': connecting equipment via the internet. This seems also turned to be a balloon. "It was actually meant to get media attention. There is no concrete plan or so", says an intended business partner. Other information on the website - which goes black after questions from this newspaper - raises questions at least. For example, BiQ claims to have invested last year in Angellist Europe Ltd, Opentrader Ltd and Favoom Corp. Separate companies with their own legal structure. But these companies do not exist at all; these are the tradenames of BiQ Group NV. "It is indeed a typo," says the entrepreneur when asked for an explanation.   Image Building a good image is important, and Van Steenbergen knows that all too well. Officially, the BiQ Group NV has their office in the prestigious Evoluon building in Eindhoven. But this turns out to be a flexible workplace and not an office at all. Van Steenbergen just operates from a terraced house in Eindhoven-Noord. In the mean time Van Steenbergen conducts business on the cutting edge. When he smells money he does not hesitate to start into a whole new branch, such as the agricultural sector. Like now with Nistelrode and the manure processor in Sterksel. A little more than a year ago, Van Steenbergen - who made a name for himself with 'piepers' last decade – got attention in the national media with a lawsuit against KPN. This Telecom giant would have unlawfully gotten the paging customers of Euromessage, a company the entrepreneur had sold. During interim proceedings the judge ruled different and for the time being KPN was vindicated. Van Steenbergen says that main proceedings will follow. A few months earlier Van Steenbergen had more success: the judge agreed with the bankruptcy he had applied for from the same company: Euromessage.  Van Steenbergen also has political ambitions, as it turns out. His first cautious steps in the political arena however seem to have come to nothing. The political movement Politiek Correct, established in 2012 with Van Steenbergen as sole board member never submitted an electoral list, according to the Electoral Council.  To be continued – that is for sure.  Author: HUB DOHME Date:  23 MAART 2016, 14:49   (in the meantime BiQ Group, named group but in fact a small company, went also bankrupt)  In the photograph shown in the article Christiaan van Steenbergen is on the leftside:  https://imagize[Suspicious link removed]ageshack.com/v2/xq90/922/t30vys.png

Author: glebj
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: Profit sharing = all of the platforms profits - necessary expenditures to keep it running. It is decentralized. ICO price closed at 1 ETH= 1,000 NEXT. Current circulating supply is around 45 million NEXT. We do not want to include all of our devs on the site in order to protect source code, there are about 11.

Author: Wekkel
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: If you paid with BTC, the amount of tokens will be shown on your member page on the website. If you pay with Ether, you will receive NEXT tokens in your MEW wallet. So there is a difference here. Did you check your member page for the number of NEXT tokens assigned to you?

Author: next.exchange
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: Thanks, Wekkel! You say it correct.  If people buy with BTC the tokens become visible in their Wallet on NEXT.exchange. If people buy with ETH it will become visible in their Ethereum wallet.  In this case, he created an unique BTC address on the NEXT.exchange page, where he transfer BTC and for exchange he got 400 NEXT tokens. The tokens are visible on his member page. Instead of looking there, he is going into panic mode and call us scammers?! Thanks, you also a happy new year.

Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: If you want to invest through ETH, due to the latest blockchain's problem, please increase the gas price for the transaction along with the gas limit.  Otherwise your transaction will probably run out of gas and never go through.  To increase the GAS PRICE at MEW before you generate the transaction, find the button "Gas Price" at top right corner and increase it from there.

Author: tzegian
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: I am NOT affiliated with the project, I have just been asked to create the ANN thread.     WEBSITE - WHITEPAPER  -  TWITTER - TELEGRAM  NEXT.EXCHANGE EMBRACES BLOCKCHAIN TECHNOLOGY Incorporated in the Netherlands, NEXT.exchange is a hybrid digital asset exchange providing it's users with maximum security and the ability to trade cryptocurrencies directly with fiat currencies.   MEET THE TEAM BEHIND NEXT.EXCHANGE Christiaan van Steenbergen - Serial Entrepreneur & Founder NEXT.exchange - LinkedIn Gleb Jout - Head of PR, Marketing & Communications - LinkedIn Drs. Chris Haveman - Board advisor & Business Strategy Operations - LinkedIn Mr. Rob van Dijk - Laywer & Head of Legal Operations - LinkedIn    OUR GOAL To provide an easy to use exchange platform with a wide variety of digital asset offerings. We provide all of our users with a fiat gateway (ability to deposit/withdraw and trade fiat currencies against cryptocurrencies directly). After all, why should other legitimate digital assets experience drastic volatility swings due to Bitcoins price fluctuations? Security is at the hard of our platform, which is why on our platform, every single user has a separate Blockchain wallet address for each digital asset.   Who we are, what we offer NEXT.exchange is a trademark of OpenTrader N.V. (i.o.), a public limited liability company, incorporated and registered in the Netherlands Hybrid decentralized exchange platform Over 50 cryptocurrencies available for trading. (Such as BTC, ETH, LINK, DRGN, XEM, COLX, SNC, and others) Direct fiat to cryptocurrency trading (Purchase the above mentioned assets and more directly, with USD & EUR) Multiple pairings for each asset (BTC, ETH, USD, EUR) Fiat deposits and withdrawals, currently USD & EUR, to be expanded upon (KYC required for fiat withdrawals) Regular audits to be made publicly available on our corporate site   No central wallet! Each user on our platform has their own unique and individual Blockchain wallet address Carrier grade servers   Regular audits to be made publicly available on our corporate site       Our native token, NEXT.  NEXT provides it's holders with the following benefits: - Lower fees on transactions - Access to fiat operations (trades & withdrawals) - Priority access to newly listed assets (up to 14 days). - Entitlement to a quarterly profit share of exchange profits (Holders of 100 + NEXT are entitled to 100% of our public limited liability companies profits minus necessary operating costs. Financials to be disclosed in publicly available audits).       ROADMAP

Author: Mobile-Mining
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: Can I ask why you are still using ETN as your primary listing advert, when they haven’t even approached you?  https://i.imgur.com/6XbT9tw_d.jpg

Author: glebj
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: Ok let me clarify the situation with ETN. We are free to list ETN, due to community support and their code being open sourced. This has been confirmed by Imogen of ETN. We are not in a direct partnership with them however.  I want to clarify, that ETN is in no way our main focus point. However, ETN's community is absurdly large. Therefore, the volume of ETN related news is also large. Here is a twitter update regarding the situation. https://twitter.com/NextExchange/status/938420733117652992

Author: glebj
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: I really do not like that statement from ETN. It lacks some information.

Author: Sparky71
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: After having very slow ACH transfers with Coinbase, and noticing the prices are often higher the than on other exchanges, I am excited to see a new Exchange that is aimed as addressing these issues.  The idea of bringing stock and digital assets to one platform will make things easier on investors too.

Author: jay_j88
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: I'm new to the cryptoworld, and have only invested in a few projects, but those that I did invest in required me to either buy coins via an exchange or mine them.. As my computer is nowhere near what it should be for mining and I also do not have a mining rig the only way to get in on the projects is by buying on an exchange.  Of the exchanges I've registered for I've only heard back from two of them after sending my ID months ago.. The higher-end exchanges have 'pending status.'  I just want to be able to buy Altcoins using my bank account (Canadian) without having to go from Bitcoin or Ethereum.    NEXT promises to do that.  I hope they set something up for early investors to get verified before they go live!  Regardless, this project looks promising.  It'll make noobs like me a easier time to invest in altcoins and not have to convert and lose value of what we actually put in initially (no matter how little).

Author: tzegian
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: From now on you can invest with Bitcoin or straight via Bank Transfer if you want. You can find these options at Members Area after you register/login.

Author: CryptoBacon
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: I've got fiat ready in PayPal.. 😁 yeee haa! It's long overdue for an exchange like Next so it's exciting imo..

Author: Sparky71
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: So true.  It’s fine for being your first exchange and getting started in crypto.  But 2 mo tha later I need so much more.  I am excited for Dec14.  Bring me ease of use, access to alt coins with my fiat, and low exchange costs and I’ll be with Next for a long time!  Plus, dividends for holding my NEXT tokens.  Whoever heard of that!!

Body: The project seems quite interesting indeed. Do I understand correctly that your trading platform is ready? Or you can build a platform in less than a month (if so, congrats!)? Also, what would be the percentage of the profits going back to the investors?

Author: Sparky71
Title: [ANN] NEXT.exchange hybrid cryptocurrency exchange platform.
Body: On Telegram channel they announced that the platform will be ready for investors to start using on 14 December.  Public can use it 1 Jan 2018.
